content.description: Start just right of Pick Of the Litter. Follow the line of shallow pockets placing gear to a hidden pin. Continue up to the high bolt (crux). Finish up and left to the Pick of the Litter anchor.
content.location: Right of Pick of the Litter

content.description: Look for the safe looking climb on the left end of the crag. Climb past 4 bolts to horizontals that take gear. (I did not see the pin referenced in the guide). Move right and follow the jugs into a small right facing corner with good gear. Move up to the ring anchor on top.
content.location: Left end of the crag. The only climb with four bolts.

content.description: Climb the arete just right of Hairline. Clip three bolts to the top. A great warm up.
content.protection: Three bolts to a rap anchor.

content.description: Climb the slab on the far right hand side of the cliff. It just needs to be climbed to stay clean.
content.protection: Might be some gear, trees half way and tree anochor at top, can walk off to climbers right.
content.location: The route is on the far right hand side of the cliff. It's the only low angle slab out there.

content.description: Pick Of The Litter is a steep slab sitting on top of a separate knoll just south of White's Ledge. A short approach and the river near by makes it a fun summer time crag. Although many climbs have bolts be sure to bring a normal rack. The crag ranges from 50-90'. Another short wall with a handful of routes sits 100 yards to the right of the main wall.
